intro: Eritrichium tuvinense, commonly known as the Tuvinian mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
